## HttpErrorSerializer.serializeResponse property

Serializes an HttpError into a client-safe error response. This method ensures no sensitive information (like stack traces or internal messages) is exposed to clients.

**Signature:**

```typescript
serializeResponse: (error: HttpError) => {
        errorType: "Server";
        error: {
            name: string;
            message: string;
            code: unknown;
        };
    };
```

## Example


```typescript
app.use((error: Error, req: Request, res: Response, next: NextFunction) => {
  if (error instanceof HttpError) {
    const clientResponse = serializer.serializeResponse(error);
    return res.status(error.statusCode).json(clientResponse);
  }
  // Handle other error types...
});
```
